title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC).

One point is earned for showing a vertical long-run Phillips curve (LRPC) and the point A to the right of the LRPC on the SRPC.
descriptions:
No points earned.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC).

One point is earned for showing a vertical long-run Phillips curve (LRPC) and the point A to the right of the LRPC on the SRPC.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC).

One point is earned for showing a vertical long-run Phillips curve (LRPC) and the point A to the right of the LRPC on the SRPC.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of AD/AS showing the equilibrium output, Ye, and price level, PLe.

One point is earned for showing Yf to the right of Ye.
descriptions:
No points earned.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of AD/AS showing the equilibrium output, Ye, and price level, PLe.

One point is earned for showing Yf to the right of Ye.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

One point is earned for showing Yf to the right of Ye.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for showing a leftward shift of the AD curve and indicating Y2 and PL2.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for showing a leftward shift of the AD curve and indicating Y2 and PL2.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for showing a leftward shift of the AD curve and indicating Y2 and PL2.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
4 points

One point is earned for stating that the Federal Reserve should decrease administered interest rates (e.g., decrease interest on reserves).

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the reserve market with the supply curve intersecting the demand curve in the range of ample reserves.

One point is earned for showing a decrease in the administered interest rates, resulting in a lower policy rate.

One point is earned for concluding that the price level will increase because the Federal Reserve action increases interest- sensitive spending (e.g., investment and consumption) and aggregate demand.

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

One point is earned for stating that the short-run aggregate supply will increase because wages and other input prices will decrease.

One point is earned for stating that the natural rate of unemployment remains unchanged.
descriptions:
No points earned.

One point is earned for stating that the short-run aggregate supply will increase because wages and other input prices will decrease.

One point is earned for stating that the natural rate of unemployment remains unchanged.
